title: Law and the New Commons
author: A. R. Delaine
annotation: A field guide to commons-oriented legal architectures, with examples from municipal and cooperative governance.
citation: Delaine, A. R. (2018). Law and the New Commons. Meridian Press.

title: Constitutional Imagination in Digital Polities
author: Mina Okafor
annotation: Explores constitutional design patterns for online civic institutions and jurisdictional overlap.
citation: Okafor, M. (2022). Constitutional imagination in digital polities. Journal of Civic Systems, 14(2), 55-88.

title: Jurisprudence for Beginners
author: Leila Tann
annotation: A concise lecture introducing schools of legal thought and practical pathways into legal reasoning.
citation: Tann, L. (Producer). (2021). Jurisprudence for beginners [Video]. ULS Open Lectures.

title: Bioregional Rights and River Personhood
author: Nikhil Santos
annotation: Comparative review of river-personhood cases with implementation lessons for local legal systems.
citation: Santos, N. (2020). Bioregional rights and river personhood. Comparative Environmental Law Review, 9(3), 201-233.
